result.execSummary:
The defendant Shamar Junior Everette was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Consecutive to: any other sentence
Consecutive to: sentence currently being served

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall reimburse the Clerk of Courts for attorney fees as previously ordered or judgment shall be entered. 

If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, and shall complete any recommended treatment.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 

Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment, schooling or combination of both.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Judgment of Conviction; no mail receptacle

Defendant Shamar Junior Everette in court.  Attorney Deborah Ann Strigenz in court for Shamar Junior Everette.  Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. CASES CALLED:  22CM682 & 22CM623.  Agreement reached.  State moves to dismiss and read-in Ct 2 and 22CM623; Court so orders.  Def enters no contest plea to Ct 1.  Court finds def guilty on Ct 1.  Statements from State, counsel and def.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

(Copy mailed to Def and Def Atty)

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shamar Junior Everette in court, in custody.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Shamar Junior Everette. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Def does not qualify for SPD and req court appointed counsel.  Court appoints Atty Strigenz.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate of $50 per month commencing 8-15-22. Court sets $500 signature bond.  Court enters NG pleas on behalf of def.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.
